document.masterDocTitle: The Afrotropical species of Habritella Girault & Dodd (Hymenoptera: Pteromalidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Afrotropical species of Habritella Girault & Dodd (Hymenoptera: Pteromalidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Alexandru Ioan Cuza’ University of Iași, Faculty of Biology, Bd. Carol I 20 A, 700505 Iași, Romania.

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 2. Habritella mandibulata sp. nov. A, C, G. Holotype, ♀ (NHMUK). B, H. Allotype, ♂ (NHMUK). D–F. Paratype, ♀ (NHMUK). A. Habitus in lateral view. B. Habitus in lateral view. C. Head in frontal view. D. Detail of mesosoma in dorsal view. E. Metasoma in dorsal view. F. Fore wing in dorsal view. G. Antenna in lateral view.H. Antenna in lateral view (inset: detail of clava indicating the terminal process).

subSubSection.paragraph: The specific epithet is an indication to the unusually large mandibles of this species.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 2.
Habritella mandibulata
sp. nov. A, C, G . Holotype, ♀ (NHMUK). B, H . Allotype, ♂ (NHMUK). D–F . Paratype, ♀ (NHMUK). A . Habitus in lateral view. B . Habitus in lateral view. C . Head in frontal view. D . Detail of mesosoma in dorsal view. E . Metasoma in dorsal view. F . Fore wing in dorsal view. G . Antenna in lateral view. H . Antenna in lateral view (inset: detail of clava indicating the terminal process).

subSubSection.paragraph: Differs from the female holotype mainly in the following. Body length: 2.1 mm . Metasoma with pale spot in basal half. Antenna 11263, fu1 distinctly smaller than fu2. Flagellar setae longer, denser and more erect ( Fig. 2H ). Clava with very short spike-like terminal process ( Fig. 2H ). Metasoma oval, distinctly shorter than head plus mesosoma, distal tergites partly retracted. Metasoma L: 70, W: 32.
Body length: 2.30–2.75 mm . MV 2.10–2.25 × SV. Metasoma length 2.5–3.5× width. The metasoma is slightly distorted in the holotype hence appearing wider than normal.
